@glample There's a very simple reason why we don't want people to save Variables as attributes - if they were created as a result of some computation, they will be kept around and they won't free the graph nodes preceding it.

We wanted to think of Modules as thin wrappers around functions that only hold some persistent state like parameters, never any temporary objects (this is handy e.g. for serialization - there's no need for clearState(), etc.).

I agree it's quite a nice patter, but I'm not sure if we should allow this. @colesbury, any thoughts?
